intro: Struthanthus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of showy yellow or orange flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Struthanthus angustifolius is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
